|fam2=AtlanticâCongo |fam3=VoltaâNiger |fam4=Gbe |iso3=gej}} 'Gen' (also called
'{{Unicode|GÉÌ}}', '{{Unicode|GÉn gbe}}', 'Gebe', 'Guin', 'Mina', 'Mina-Gen',
and 'Popo') is a Gbe language spoken in the southeast of Togo in the Maritime
Region. It is also spoken in the Mono Department of Benin. It is part of the
VoltaâNiger branch of the major African NigerâCongo language family. Like the
other Gbe languages, Gen is a tonal language.

According to [http://www.ethnologue.com/show_language.asp?code=gej
SIL/Ethnologue], there are 200,000 Gen-speakers in Togo in 1991, and 130,000 in
Benin in 2006.
